<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our Key Performance Indicator (KPI) index (described below) reached 104% of our 2012 operating goals; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Attainment of $90M in 2012 general and administrative (G&amp;A) expense savings which exceeded our 2012 goal and on track to achieve $145M in savings
by 2014; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Completed construction of 447 MW of installed capacity during 2012 and we are on schedule to complete an additional 2,181 MW of capacity under
construction expected to come on-line through 2015; and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Continued execution of our portfolio management program by closing twelve asset sales since September 2011, representing equity proceeds to AES of
nearly $1B. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">However, in 2012, the Company also faced challenging conditions in many markets. Low natural gas and power
prices in the U.S. Midwest were key drivers of a significant impairment of Dayton Power &amp; Light (&#147;DP&amp;L&#148;). These adverse conditions negatively impacted our share price in 2012, which in turn, contributed to significant reductions to
the value of our Executive Officers&#146; outstanding equity awards, including the forfeiture of the 2010-2012 performance stock units, as discussed further below. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>2012 Compensation Highlights </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Compensation determinations made in 2012 reflect our
pay-for-performance philosophy and the Company&#146;s intent to align its Executive Officer compensation with the interests of stockholders. The key compensation determinations made with respect to our NEOs are summarized below. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In 2012, several of our NEOs were recently promoted into their positions and, thus, target total compensation was below our 50</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">th</SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> percentile philosophy; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our CEO did not receive a salary increase in 2012 because his compensation was changed in the latter part of 2011 upon being promoted to CEO;
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our other NEOs received salary increases ranging from 4% to 12.5% with the largest increases for NEOs promoted in 2011, since those NEOs did not
receive a salary increase at the time of the promotion; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Annual incentive awards to our NEOs averaged 98% of the target award amount as the Company did not meet 100% of its 2012 annual objectives;
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The performance stock units for the three-year period ended December&nbsp;31, 2012 were forfeited because the Company did not attain the relative Total
Stockholder Return performance threshold; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The performance units for the three-year period ended December&nbsp;31, 2012 paid out at 84% of target because the Company performed below the target
on its three-year cumulative Cash Value Added goal (described below); and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The total realizable value of all long-term compensation awards granted within the past three years (2010-2012) to our current Executive Officers is
significantly below the target grant date value of such awards. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">16 </FONT></P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">With respect to performance stock unit awards for which the performance period is not yet complete, the value is based on our current period-to-date results against the
performance goals (our current period-to-date results for incomplete periods are between threshold and target). </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">


<IMG SRC="g472991g13m65.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Our Executive Compensation Practices </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Compensation Committee frequently reviews developments in governance practices and market trends relating to executive compensation and has taken several actions intended to align the design and
structure of AES&#146; executive compensation program, including our NEOs&#146; compensation, with current standards of governance and our stockholders&#146; interests. The actions taken by the Compensation Committee include both adopting and
discontinuing practices so as to align executive compensation with stockholder interests. The following points summarize key actions taken by the Committee in recent years, with changes made in 2012 and early 2013 noted below. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>&#149;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Target Total Compensation at
50<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">th</SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> Percentile of Companies Comparable in Size
</FONT></B></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our philosophy is to target total compensation at the size-adjusted 50th percentile of survey
data to ensure a competitive compensation opportunity compared to similarly-sized companies; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>&#149;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B></B><B>Heavy Weight on Performance-based Compensation </B></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:7%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our compensation program is heavily weighted to performance-based pay with a significant portion of our compensation being paid through our annual incentive and long-term compensation plans; </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>&#149;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Executive Stock Ownership Guidelines </B></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:7%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We maintain stock ownership guidelines to align our NEOs&#146; interests with those of our stockholders; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>&#149;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Independent Consultant Retained by the Compensation Committee </B></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our Compensation Committee has retained and directs an independent compensation consultant who does not provide any other services to the
Company; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>&#149;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Annual Review of Risk Related to Compensation Programs </B></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Compensation Committee&#146;s independent consultant annually conducts a review of the risks associated with our executive and
incentive compensation programs and has determined that our compensation programs are not reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on the Company; </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">17 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>&#149;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Clawback Policy </B></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:7%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In early 2013, the Company adopted a &#147;clawback&#148; policy that provides the Compensation Committee with the discretion to seek recoupment of certain previously-paid incentive awards in the event
that such awards are linked to a financial restatement caused by executive misconduct; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>&#149;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Executive Severance Provisions Comparable to Market Practice </B></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Company maintains an Executive Severance Plan which provides for severance benefits under certain termination scenarios, including
termination in connection with a change-in-control. The benefits under these plans are comparable to what other companies similar in size offer to their executives; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>&#149;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>No Change-in-Control Excise Tax Gross-ups </B></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:7%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In 2012, the Company modified its executive change-in-control severance arrangements to entirely discontinue the provision of change-in-control excise tax gross-ups; </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>&#149;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>No Perquisites for our Executive Officers </B></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:7%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We do not provide perquisites to any of our Executive Officers; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>&#149;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>No Special Retirement Benefit Formulas for our Executive Officers </B></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:7%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our supplemental executive retirement benefits are designed primarily to restore benefits capped under our broad-based retirement plans
due to statutory limits imposed by the Internal Revenue Code (the &#147;Code&#148;); </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>&#149;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>No Backdating or Option Repricings </B></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:7%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We have not participated in a practice of backdating or repricing stock options, nor have we modified pre-set targets for annual incentive or performance equity awards; and </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>&#149;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>No Hedging or Pledging of AES Common Stock </B></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:7%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In early 2013, the Board of Directors adopted a policy that prohibits Section&nbsp;16 Officers, including our NEOs, and Directors of the Company from hedging their economic interest in AES Common Stock or
using AES Common Stock as collateral in a financial transaction. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">These practices are discussed in further detail throughout the remainder of
this CD&amp;A. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Results of 2012 Advisory Vote to Approve Executive Compensation (&#147;2012 Say on Pay Vote&#148;) </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">At its 2012 annual meeting of stockholders, AES received over 95% support for its NEO compensation based on the shares voted in favor of the 2012 Say on
Pay vote. This outcome confirmed the Company&#146;s view that the NEO compensation program is performance-based and aligns with our stockholders&#146; interests. In making future decisions on NEO compensation, the Compensation Committee will
consider the outcome of future annual Say on Pay votes, including the vote to be taken in 2013. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="tx472991_10"></A>Our Executive
Compensation Process </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>The Role of Our Compensation Committee </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Compensation Committee has primary responsibility for oversight of the Company&#146;s compensation and employee benefit plans and practices which cover our NEOs. The Compensation Committee also
reviews the Company&#146;s succession plan for the NEOs and other key positions. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our philosophy is to provide compensation opportunities that
approximate the size-adjusted 50th percentile of survey data based on our revenue size and industry. We then design our incentive plans to pay for performance with more compensation paid when performance exceeds expectations and less compensation
paid when performance does not meet expectations. Thus, the actual compensation realized by an NEO could be above or below the 50th percentile based on our actual performance. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">18 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In applying this philosophy, the Compensation Committee annually reviews the compensation of our NEOs to
determine whether compensation changes are appropriate. The Compensation Committee may provide merit-based adjustments to salary and adjust target annual incentive percentages. Also, the Compensation Committee decides the grant date expected value
of long-term compensation awards for which the NEOs are eligible each year. These decisions represent each NEO&#146;s target total compensation opportunity for that year. In making these decisions, the Compensation Committee reviews survey data as
described in the section titled &#147;How We Use Survey Data in our Executive Compensation Process.&#148; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Compensation Committee
considers the information it receives and exercises its own independent judgment in making executive compensation recommendations to our Board of Directors. The Compensation Committee&#146;s recommendations are based on a review of: (1)&nbsp;survey
data; (2)&nbsp;the individual&#146;s performance against pre-set goals and objectives for the year and overall Company performance; (3)&nbsp;the individual&#146;s experience and expertise; (4)&nbsp;the individual&#146;s position and scope of
responsibilities; (5)&nbsp;the individual&#146;s future prospects with the Company; and (6) total compensation. Also, as discussed further below, the Compensation Committee retains an independent compensation consultant that provides advice and
information that the Compensation Committee reviews in evaluating executive compensation decisions. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Compensation Committee is also
responsible for assessing Company performance to determine and recommend payouts under incentive plans. To assess Company performance, the Compensation Committee receives a detailed summary of the Company&#146;s overall performance against its
pre-set targets for the year and, in the case of long-term compensation awards with performance criteria, the Company&#146;s performance against pre-set targets for the three-year performance period. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>The Role of the Compensation Committee&#146;s Independent Consultant </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In 2012, the Compensation Committee retained the services of its own independent consultant, Meridian Compensation Partners, LLC (&#147;Meridian&#148;), who provided the Compensation Committee with
independent knowledge and experience related to executive compensation. Throughout the year, Meridian reported directly and exclusively to the Compensation Committee and provided objective input and analysis with reference to market data, trends,
regulatory initiatives, governance best practices and emerging governance norms. Meridian&#146;s services included providing advice on determining the actual compensation amounts to be paid to the NEOs. During 2012, Meridian participated in seven
Compensation Committee meetings either in person or by telephone. During 2012, Meridian provided no services to AES other than executive compensation services. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Compensation Committee has reviewed the independence of Meridian relative to the final rules released by the SEC relating to the engagement of advisors by a compensation committee. In reviewing the
six factors identified in the final rules, no information was presented which would affect Meridian&#146;s independence. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>The Role of
Our Management </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our CEO participates in all Compensation Committee meetings, excluding any of the executive sessions or sessions of the
Compensation Committee in which his compensation and performance are discussed and approved. His role in the process of determining executive compensation is to provide the Compensation Committee with an assessment of each NEO&#146;s performance
against his/her pre-set goals and objectives, and to provide his initial recommendations for each NEO&#146;s compensation (other than his own). </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our VP, Human Resources develops written background and supporting materials for review by the Compensation Committee prior to its meetings and presents
information relating to specific elements of our compensation program. If warranted, she also proposes changes to our annual incentive and long-term compensation plans. In addition, she attends all Compensation Committee meetings. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The CEO and VP, Human Resources also provide the Compensation Committee with information about the Company&#146;s overall performance to enable the
Compensation Committee to make compensation decisions based on the Company&#146;s performance, consistent with our pay-for-performance philosophy. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">19 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">With the Compensation Committee&#146;s knowledge and approval, the Human Resources team also directly
interfaces with Meridian to prepare the necessary background information for the Compensation Committee. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>How We Use Survey Data in our
Executive Compensation Process </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">At the time it decides target total compensation opportunities, the Compensation Committee reviews
survey data from Towers Watson. The data enables the Compensation Committee to compare compensation for our NEOs to compensation provided by similarly-sized general industry and energy companies for executives in comparable positions to our NEOs.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In 2012, we used survey data from Towers Watson&#146;s U.S. General Industry and U.S. Energy Industry Databases. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The U.S. General Industry Database consisted of 411 companies, including 91 companies with revenues from $10 to $20 billion (AES is in this size
category). </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The U.S. Energy Industry Database consisted of 108 companies, including 33 companies with revenues over $6 billion (AES is in this size category).
Also, the majority of the companies comprising the S&amp;P 500 Utilities Index in February 2012 were included in the U.S. Energy Industry Database. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Survey data typically lag the year for which the compensation decision will apply and therefore are aged at an annualized rate of 3%&nbsp;per year. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">To size-adjust market data, we used regression analysis, when available, to provide the most accurate indication of the compensation that companies with
corporate revenue size comparable to AES (or business unit revenue for executives with responsibility over a portion of the Company&#146;s operations) provide to executives in comparable roles and that have international operations which may compete
with AES for talent. Regression analysis predicts the compensation paid by companies closest to us in size. Executive target total compensation more closely correlates with revenue than any other company size indicator for general and energy
industry companies. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">With the exceptions noted below, the Compensation Committee reviewed survey data at the time it made decisions on target
total compensation for most of our NEOs in 2012. For some NEOs, a blend of general industry and energy industry data is appropriate based on the operational knowledge required of their positions and the international scope of their roles. For other
NEOs, general industry data is appropriate based on the NEO&#146;s responsibility over a major staff function within the Company (e.g., Legal, IT, HR) and the international scope of their roles. This approach is summarized below. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="67%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="9%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="10%"></TD>
<TD></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">NEO</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Equal&nbsp;Blend&nbsp;of</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">General&nbsp;Industry&nbsp;and</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Energy&nbsp;Company&nbsp;Data</FONT></P></TD>

<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">During the Company&#146;s annual performance and compensation review in 2012, neither Ms.&nbsp;Wood nor Ms.&nbsp;Hackenson were Executive Officers and,
therefore, their respective 2012 compensation was set based on our internal management compensation structure. Upon becoming Executive Officers in 2012, there was no material change to their overall compensation. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">20 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Compensation Committee made a change to the survey data it referenced in deciding Mr.&nbsp;O&#146;Flynn&#146;s compensation compared to the data
used to decide Ms.&nbsp;Harker&#146;s compensation. In recruiting a new CFO, the Company&#146;s primary search and selection criteria were prior energy industry experience and prior experience in companies with international operations. Thus, the
Compensation Committee deemed that changing to a blend of general industry and energy industry data was more appropriate for our CFO role. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">To understand the full range of compensation within our relative market, the survey data reviewed by the Compensation Committee provides a market comparison at the 25th, 50th and 75th percentiles for each
position in order to be consistent with market practices employed in the analysis of survey data. The Compensation Committee determines target total compensation for our NEOs after taking into account a range of factors, including (1)&nbsp;the
survey data, (2)&nbsp;individual and Company performance, (3)&nbsp;individual experience and expertise, (4)&nbsp;position scope and responsibilities, (5)&nbsp;future prospects with the Company, and (6) total compensation. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:0px; "><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For 2012, target total compensation for our NEOs compared to the market percentile data as summarized in the following table. As
indicated previously, in 2012, several of our NEOs were new to their position and, thus, their target total compensation was below the 50</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">th</SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> percentile. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="84%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="center">

Counsel</FONT></P></TD>

STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">th</SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> percentile (by 5-10%)</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Ms. Harker, former
CFO</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">th</SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> and 50</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP

Generation</FONT></P></TD>

</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Ms.&nbsp;Hackenson and Ms.&nbsp;Wood are excluded from the above table because the Compensation Committee has not
reviewed survey data for their positions. Beginning in 2013, the Compensation Committee will review survey data for Ms.&nbsp;Hackenson&#146;s position. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In early 2012, the Compensation Committee was also provided with executive compensation data disclosed in proxy statements of the comparably-sized utility and power generation companies listed below.
Given the detailed nature of proxy data, it provided an additional point of reference. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Compensation Committee does not explicitly consider the proxy data in making its decisions based on two
considerations. First, the proxy data lags the survey data by one year. Second, though these companies are comparable from an industry perspective, the international nature of AES&#146; operations sets it apart from these companies. Therefore, the
Compensation Committee views the Towers Watson survey data as providing a complete and current view of similarly-sized companies with international operations against whom we compete for talent. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">21 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Independent Consultant&#146;s Review of Survey Data </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">With respect to the various uses of survey data described above, the Compensation Committee&#146;s independent consultant reviewed the survey data and
underlying methodology prior to it being shared with the Compensation Committee. The independent consultant concluded that the data sources selected by AES were appropriate for purposes of comparing its NEOs to comparable executives at
similarly-sized general industry and energy companies, and that the data aging methodology and 3% rate were supported by market practice. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>CEO Compensation Relative to other NEOs </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our CEO&#146;s compensation is higher than the compensation paid to our other NEOs largely due to the scope of his position and his overall responsibility for the Company&#146;s strategy and direction, as
well as his overall influence on AES&#146; near- and long-term performance, in general. When compared to our other NEOs, our CEO&#146;s total direct compensation is more heavily weighted towards incentive compensation and his stock ownership
guideline is higher. The higher compensation and different mix for our CEO are consistent with the survey data described above. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="tx472991_11">
</A>Overview of AES Total Compensation </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Elements of Compensation </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The following table lists each element of compensation and explains what the element is designed to reward, the objective of each element, and why we choose to pay each element. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP STYLE="BORDER:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>Element of<BR>Compensation</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>Description</B></FONT></TD></TR>


<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Base Salary</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8px">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I><U>Objective:</U></I> Provide fixed cash compensation for each job position that is
competitive and reflects the individual&#146;s experience, responsibility and expertise</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I><U>Designed to reward:</U> </I>Rewards accomplishment of day-to-day job
responsibilities; increases in salary take into account individual performance as well as other factors such as an NEO&#146;s competitive positioning</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I><U>Why we choose to pay:</U></I> Market competitive and helps to attract and retain
our NEOs</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Performance</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Incentive Plan</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(our annual incentive plan)</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8px">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I><U>Objective:</U></I> Provide performance-based, short-term cash compensation relative
to the achievement of pre-set, financial, operational and Company-wide strategic objectives, and individual performance accomplishments and contributions</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I><U>Designed to reward:</U> </I>Subject to achieving threshold performance goals, NEOs
may receive 50-200% of the target incentive award based on achievement of pre-set financial, operational and strategic objectives</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I><U>Why we choose to pay:</U></I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#150;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Direct incentive to achieve the Company&#146;s financial, operational
and strategic objectives for the year</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#150;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Market competitive and
helps to attract and retain our NEOs</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Long-Term Compensation</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8px">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I><U>Objective:</U></I> Provide equity-based awards that align the interests of our
executives with those of our stockholders</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I><U>Designed to reward:</U> </I>Share price growth, dividend performance and attainment of long-term financial goals</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I></I><I><U>Why we
choose to pay:</U> </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#150;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Directly links NEOs&#146; interests with those of stockholders and AES
long-term financial performance</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#150;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Helps to build NEO stock
ownership which further aligns NEOs&#146; interests with those of stockholders</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#150;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Market competitive and helps to attract and retain our
NEOs</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">22 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="82%"></TD></TR>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP STYLE="BORDER:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>Element of<BR>Compensation</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>Description</B></FONT></TD></TR>


<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Retirement and Health and Welfare Benefits</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8px">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I><U>Objective:</U></I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#150;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Provide competitive retirement and health and welfare benefits that are
generally comparable to those provided by our broad-based U.S. employee population</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#150;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our non-qualified Restoration Supplemental Retirement Plan
(&#147;RSRP&#148;) is provided to restore benefits limited under our broad-based retirement plans due to statutory limits imposed by the Internal Revenue Code</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:6.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;There are no special or enhanced benefit formulas under the RSRP</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I><U>Designed
to reward:</U> </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#150;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All U.S. employees are offered retirement and health and welfare
benefits in connection with their performance of services for the Company</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#150;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All individuals above a certain income threshold, including our NEOs,
are offered the RSRP</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.50em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I></I><I><U>Why we choose to pay:</U> </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#150;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Consistent with our approach for the broad-based population</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:4.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#150;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Market competitive and helps to attract and retain our
NEOs</FONT></P></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>How We Determine Each Element of Compensation </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Company does not target a specific allocation of cash versus equity compensation, nor does it target a specific allocation between short and long-term compensation. Instead the Compensation Committee
sets each individual element of total compensation based on a review of: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Survey data for each element of total compensation; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Individual performance against pre-set goals and objectives for the year and Company performance; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">An individual&#146;s experience and expertise; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Position and scope of responsibilities; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The new total compensation that would result from any change and how the new total compensation compares to survey data on total compensation.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For our current Executive Officers, the allocation between cash- and equity-based compensation as well as short- and
long-term compensation that result from this process is as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For our CEO, over 70% of compensation is at-risk and performance-based, and over 60% is equity-based. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>

</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Compensation Committee does not explicitly consider other factors in making compensation decisions, including prior
years&#146; awards or current equity holdings. The Committee does, however, annually review &#147;Tally Sheets&#148; to ensure it has a detailed understanding of how its decisions on individual compensation elements affect other compensation
elements and total compensation. For each NEO, the Tally Sheets provide the Compensation Committee with detailed information on: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A discussion of how the Compensation Committee determined each element of compensation for 2012 is provided in the next section of this CD&amp;A. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="tx472991_12"></A>2012 Compensation Determinations </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Base Salary
</I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As explained in the section titled &#147;Our Executive Compensation Process,&#148; the Compensation Committee reviews the base
salaries of our NEOs annually. In addition, the Compensation Committee will review the base salary of an NEO if there is a promotion (and a salary adjustment is being proposed) and in the case of a newly-hired NEO. In 2012, the Compensation
Committee reviewed base salaries of our NEOs as described below. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:0px; "><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In February 2012, the Compensation Committee reviewed
base salaries of our Executive Officers at the time. As previously discussed, the Compensation Committee did not adjust the base salary of Mr.&nbsp;Gluski because his compensation was changed in the latter half of 2011 upon being promoted to CEO. In
the case of our other NEOs, the Compensation Committee awarded salary increases ranging from 4% to 12.5%, with the largest increases for NEOs that were promoted in 2011 but did not receive a salary adjustment at the time of promotion and, therefore,
had a base salary that was below the 50</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">th</SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> percentile.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

Ms.&nbsp;Hackenson were Executive Officers and, therefore, their respective 2012 salary was set based on our internal management compensation structure. Upon becoming Executive Officers in 2012, there was no material change to their overall
compensation. Ms.&nbsp;Hackenson received a 2012 base salary of $407,453 and Ms.&nbsp;Wood received a base salary of $425,000 as interim CFO. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">24 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:0px; "><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In August 2012, we announced the appointment of Mr.&nbsp;O&#146;Flynn as our CFO. In
setting Mr.&nbsp;O&#146;Flynn&#146;s base salary of $650,000, the Compensation Committee reviewed survey data as previously discussed. The salary for Mr.&nbsp;O&#146;Flynn was consistent with the survey 50</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">th</SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> percentile data. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Further details on 2012 base salaries paid to our NEOs can be found in the Summary Compensation Table beginning on page 39 of this Proxy Statement.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>2012 Performance Incentive Plan Payouts </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>2012 Company Performance Score Targets:</U> Our NEOs are eligible for annual incentive awards under the Performance Incentive Plan, a stockholder-approved plan which is intended to preserve the tax
deductibility of annual incentive awards paid by the Company under Section&nbsp;162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code. Under the Performance Incentive Plan, the NEOs were eligible to receive a maximum payout capped at 0.17% of EBITDA for the CEO and
0.07% of EBITDA for each of the other NEOs. Assuming the Company achieves positive EBITDA and awards are payable, the Compensation Committee has the right but not the obligation to exercise negative discretion. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Subject to its discretionary authority to reduce the award, the final annual incentive awards paid to the NEOs were based on certain additional
pre-established measures. As described more fully below, in the first quarter of 2012, the Compensation Committee established measures in four categories: Safety, Financial, Performance Improvement and Enterprise-Wide Objectives. In setting these
additional performance measures, the Compensation Committee considered information provided by Management about the Company&#146;s strategy, financial budget for the year and operational objectives. The Compensation Committee approved targets across
all measures that it considered to be highly challenging. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="49%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="47%"></TD></TR>


<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px; padding-right:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;Safety &#150; 10%
weight</B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px; padding-right:8px">
<P STYLE="margin-left:0.44em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Safety is a critical measure for AES given the dangers inherent in the operation of our business. The Company has a global safety program which encourages its
businesses to promote safety, and safety is a key corporate value.</I></FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" COLSPAN="3" NOWRAP STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px; padding-right:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Workplace safety incidents</FONT><br><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Improvement in lost time incident (LTI) case
rate</FONT><br><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Implementation of the third year of our three-year safety improvement program, including:</FONT><br><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#150;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Monthly safety walk targets;</FONT><br><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#150;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Monthly safety meeting
attendance;</FONT><br><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#150;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Design of combined environmental and safety standards;
and</FONT><br><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#150;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Redesign of the existing integrated environmental, health and safety audit process.</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>

<P STYLE="margin-left:0.44em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Financial measures were included to ensure the payouts to our NEOs align with value creation to stockholders. The 2012 targets, set forth below, were equal to our

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:3.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Adjusted EPS: $1.26</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:3.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Adjusted Pre-Tax Contribution: $1,320M</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:3.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Free Cash Flow: $1,962M</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:3.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Subsidiary Distributions: $1,415M</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#150;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Distributions are important to AES because AES is a holding company
that does not derive any significant direct revenues from its own activities, but instead relies on its subsidiaries&#146; business activities and the resultant distributions to fund its debt service, investment and other cash needs.</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#150;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Subsidiary Distributions should not be construed as an alternative to
Net Cash Provided by Operating Activities, which is determined in accordance with GAAP.</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#150;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The difference between Subsidiary Distributions and Net Cash provided
by Operating Activities consists of cash generated from operating activities that is retained at the subsidiaries for a variety of reasons, which are both discretionary and non-discretionary in nature.</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:3.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Adjusted EPS, Adjusted Pre-Tax Contribution and Free Cash Flow are
reconciled to the nearest GAAP measure in the section titled &#147;Non-GAAP Measures.&#148;</FONT></P></TD></TR>

non-fuels sourcing activities</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-2.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;APEX financial benefits of
